metadata.synopsis: Jaheira and Minsc confront the Dark Urge about their recent revelation they are a Bhaalspawn. Depending on how much the player has given into Bhaal, they are either more sympathetic, or almost hostile. But either way, they are supportive and want to use their knowledge of fighting alongside Bhaalspawn in the past to convince you that you can do good

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *The sleeping blood-beast within claws and scratches at your resting mind. You are, as ever, mere hairs away from its grasp.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Another watches your body, while it is possessed by the night. You do not dream alone.*
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player opening their eyes, and a figure standing over them about a pace away - Jaheira. The player sits up.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: I think I can guess. Visions of blood on your hands. The blood in your veins, perhaps.

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

95.speaker: Jaheira
95.text: You have not confessed it all, I think. There is something in the air tonight - the scent of a terrible and familiar power.

120.speaker: Jaheira
120.text: So the game is up at last.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: There is one last piece I've been toying with. A terrible and familiar power I've sensed around you for some time.

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.text: And so I come to ask: what did it take for you to earn that Slayer-skin you hide so well?

122.speaker: Jaheira
122.text: I've slept beside a Bhaalspawn before. I know the signs - the dreams, the urges... the power.

118.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.text: If I must lie awake, then so must you - only fair, considering that you are the reason.

73.speaker: Jaheira
73.text: I've been sensing something, you see. A formless but familiar dread, which I have only now been able to put a name to.

135.speaker: Jaheira
135.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

153.speaker: Jaheira
153.text: You have not confessed it all, I think.

29.speaker: Jaheira
29.text: So the game is up at last.

129.speaker: Jaheira
129.text: Almost. There is but one piece left to play.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The ranger's thoughts flit through your own, searching, probing for something specific. Until he finds...*
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc and the player mind-melding

107.speaker: Jaheira
107.text: There we have our answer. But we might as well hear it from you.

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.text: So - what did it take to earn that new Slayer-skin of yours?

4.text: This power will save the world from the Absolute. The price doesn't matter.

82.speaker: Jaheira
82.text: I have spent my life fighting your father in whatever form he chose to take. By rights, I should cut you down here.

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: But that would be a mercy. One you have not earned.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: You are twice-tainted, yes. But whatever you have done - you might yet serve the good.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing, Jaheira sighs and shethes her weapons. She steps back [to stand beside Minsc if he's present], giving the player room to stand.

25.speaker: Minsc
25.text: What? Evil cannot serve good, Jaheira. That is why it is evil.

121.speaker: Jaheira
121.text: You know better than that, Stone Lord. We found the good in you - and we found it in another Bhaalspawn, once before.

46.speaker: Jaheira
46.text: Whatever its source, the Slayer form is a weapon like any other. And if you mean to master it, I know where you must go.

149.speaker: Jaheira
149.text: To face the other of your kind - Orin. So long as the other lives, neither of you can claim your full power.

143.speaker: Jaheira
143.text: Don't patronise me. I can do without your guidance.

14.speaker: Jaheira
14.text: It is not guidance I offer, but a leash. We will help you to control yourself - until you can free yourself of these urges, and use the Slayer form freely.

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: The burden of your blood is yours to carry, but you need not carry it alone.

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *A spike of rage, quickly muffled - Minsc's mind still lingers near your own, and he does not like what is coming to pass.*

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: What if I slip out of control again? You will kill me?

139.speaker: Jaheira
139.text: You will be protected. Even from yourself.

77.speaker: Jaheira
77.text: Come on, let's go back to sleep.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: You first. I find that sleep escapes me, so I might as well take the watch.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: Or perhaps I will take you to my Father directly - as trophies.

125.speaker: Jaheira
125.text: No need for such dramatics. I will go with eyes wide open - and the hope that I know you a little better than you know yourself.

111.speaker: Jaheira
111.text: For now, rest. Sleep escapes me, so I might as well take the watch.

48.speaker: Minsc
48.text: As will I. Jaheira tells me a debt is owed - even if my heart and hamster do not understand it.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You rest with the knowledge that you are being watched over. Or indeed, guarded.*

145.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pulling out from camp, player falling to sleep with Jaheira / and Minsc sitting down beside them.

87.text: Poke at Minsc's mind to stoke his rage.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *A single prod is enough to send his fury into a twisted spiral, wrapping around you then storming over to Jaheira.*

12.speaker: Minsc
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jerking his head furiously, mind-meld dissipating

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: Jaheira, they tried to make me... I almost...

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *For a moment, the briefest, weakest moment, Jaheira appears as she truly is. Simply an old woman, uncertain and afraid.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taking a step back in shock

98.speaker: Jaheira
98.text: Perhaps I was too swift to put up my blades. But we will not play into your father's hands this night.

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: As you wish, then. We take our leave. I hope you have mastered yourself, when next we meet. If not, we will do what we must.

110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira backs away and leaves, Minsc trailing behind.

43.speaker: Minsc
43.text: If there is still good in you - find it quickly, says Boo. Or the next time we meet, you will know my rage.

148.speaker: Jaheira
148.text: And what will become of me, if I beat her?

128.speaker: Jaheira
128.text: Show daddy dear that you alone choose your fate. You are a child of Bhaal - but that need not be all that you are.

96.speaker: Jaheira
96.text: And when you stand against him, you will not stand alone.

90.text: I intend to become Bhaal's Chosen. So bow, or die.

130.speaker: Jaheira
130.text: I am truly bored of that phrase.

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: Cast yourself into the dark if you wish. I mean to be there to pull you back - by the hand, or the scruff.

86.speaker: Minsc
86.text: You will answer for this, fiend. And it will be an answer of the screaming sort.

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding hand up to Minsc, but never taking eyes off player.

83.text: Innocent blood. As innocent as my own: I have no control over when my body kills.

117.text: Bathing in my dearest friend's gore.

17.text: Isobel was my doing... the rest of Last Light was an accident.

19.text: I stole every little life in Last Light.

45.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

33.speaker: Jaheira
33.text: Then we shall make this swift.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: For all the gifts Bhaal's children inherit - a peaceful night's sleep is not among them.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira steps forward, and we see that she's holding her scimitars, blades bared.

65.speaker: Minsc
65.text: Is this the reward for my confession? A dagger in the night?

89.speaker: Minsc
89.text: I think you are still dreaming if you see a dagger before you. She has a sword - two of them, in fact.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

53.speaker: Jaheira
53.text: The dreams alone do not concern me. It is what waking deeds they might inspire.

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: Are you truly your own master? What is it you feel, when father's dreams come calling?

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: My birthright, in all its vile glory.

47.speaker: Jaheira
47.text: That birthright may well bring you to a bloody end. How many should I allow to go with you?

62.speaker: Jaheira
62.text: Helpless. Like I can deny him nothing.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: Then would you call it mercy, if the next night I never let you wake?

137.speaker: Jaheira
137.text: It's sickening. I never asked for this power, and hope to be rid of it.

152.speaker: Jaheira
152.text: There is one certain way. I hold it in my hand.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: I don't owe you answers, especially not at sword-point.

34.speaker: Jaheira
34.text: And what is it I owe? Should I allow some horror to be born anew, when I could end it here and now?

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.text: This is your father's true legacy. Not his children - but the fear they plant in us. The savagery it blossoms into.

114.speaker: Minsc
114.text: But you have reminded us that when evil calls, we might stop our ears with virtuous cotton. Haven't they, Jaheira?
114.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc walks to stand behind Jaheira.
IF DOABLE - he clasps her shoulder, as if reminding her.

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: In another time - with another of your kind - we found a better way. I would dearly like to find it again.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing, Jaheira sighs and shethes her weapons. She steps back [to stand beside Minsc if he's present], giving the player room to stand.

133.speaker: Minsc
133.text: Tell me what I must do.

6.speaker: Minsc
6.text: Well, you cannot understand Boo's wisdom. So I suppose we must listen to Jaheira instead.

102.speaker: Minsc
102.text: My path is mine alone to choose.

56.speaker: Minsc
56.text: But not yours alone to walk.

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: Whatever path you choose, I fear it will lead you to the same point. The same enemy.

72.speaker: Minsc
72.text: And if I embrace Father's power? Grant unto him my love?

146.speaker: Minsc
146.text: It would be like swinging a sword by the wrong side. Painful - but it can be effective, too.

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.text: You would not be the first to turn the taint in your blood to your advantage. But there are barriers a Bhaalspawn must overcome, first.

136.speaker: Jaheira
136.text: Those of your kind. Orin - I am sure you already know that so long as she lives, she will never stop hunting you.

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.text: It might be that you have to turn and face her - you cannot change that. All you can choose is how you meet her: as another bloodied child of Bhaal, or as yourself.

69.speaker: Minsc
69.text: And for this, you will need Boo. He has tasted Bhaalspawn flesh before - and he would not mind another bite.

67.speaker: Jaheira
67.text: For now, take what rest you can - we will watch over you this night.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: To watch over me - or to protect against me?

40.speaker: Jaheira
40.text: I suppose you'll have your answer when you wake in the morning.

70.text: How do I know you won't kill me?

92.speaker: Minsc
92.text: Are we so faithless? As you wish - while we watch over you, Boo shall be watching over us.

147.speaker: Narrator
147.text: *No more dreams await you in sleep this night. Only the warm knowledge that, indeed - you are not alone.*

93.speaker: Jaheira
93.text: All I can offer is the promise that, should you choose to do so, you will not meet her alone.

79.speaker: Jaheira
79.text: For now, take what rest you can - I will watch over you this night.

21.speaker: Minsc
21.text: Do not thank us, friend. It is not as if we didn't consider killing you instead.

104.text: I won't sleep again. Tell me something of the old days, since they're on your mind.

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: I don't think I have any -

94.speaker: Minsc
94.text: Have you ever fought with a talking sword?

103.speaker: Jaheira
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera begins to pull out and voices fade as they continue talking into the night.

126.speaker: Minsc
126.text: Yes! A mighty blade, but a mouthy one, too. I wonder what happened to it.

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: I believe it went over a cliff-edge, buried in an ogre's backside. And it was still talking...

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: Your past is not my future.

42.speaker: Minsc
42.text: Leave the future for hathrans and hamsters to divine. We speak only of this moment.

105.text: 'A better way?' It's too late. My cruel deeds cannot be undone.

144.speaker: Jaheira
144.text: You are what you are, child of Bhaal. But that need not be all that you are.

38.text: Kill me then, coward. I dare you to try.

134.speaker: Jaheira
134.text: Ever the Bhaalspawn's lot. To bring death, or wait for it to find them.

138.speaker: Minsc
138.text: So the game is up at last.

155.speaker: Minsc
155.text: No game. A serious matter, to rouse Boo from his beauty sleep.
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

106.speaker: Minsc
106.text: Boo remembers the scent of Bhaalspawn. Like rot on the tongue - meaning no offence.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

116.speaker: Minsc
116.text: She is worrying. Which worries me. Which worries Boo. Which ought to worry you.
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

18.text: My rest was fine, until a looming druid came to pry.

112.speaker: Minsc
112.text: We do not loom, friend. We tread soft and sure as hunting hamsters.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc suddenly looms on the player's other side, surrounding them. He carries no weapon, but his hulking presence is threatening nonetheless.

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *Tonight's troubled rest is, as ever, overwhelmed by your killing fate. You dangle above a dark precipice, one move away from falling.*
